meanings.definition: To free from a snag or entanglement.
meanings.sent1: I had to unsnag my sweater from the thorny bush.
meanings.sent2: She carefully unsnagged the fishing line caught on a rock.
meanings.sent3: Trying to unsnag a kite from a tree can be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking helped unsnag the traffic jam in no time.
meanings.sent5: The hero's swift action to unsnag the rope saved the day.

meanings.definition: To remove an obstruction or impediment.
meanings.sent1: The plumber had to unsnag the clogged drain to fix it.
meanings.sent2: They worked together to unsnag the stuck door.
meanings.sent3: I had to unsnag my shoelace from the escalator - embarrassing!
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude helped unsnag the difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to unsnag any obstacles in your path.
